newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian call rates steady despite repo outflows.
newsitem.headline: Indian call rates steady despite repo outflows.

text.p: Indian call money rates opened steady at 3.75-4.50 percent on Friday against Wednesday's close of 3.50-4.00 percent, dealers said.
Banks were closed on Thursday for a national holiday.
The call rates are expected to remain steady for the rest of the fortnight, a dealer at state-run bank said.
Call money has been quoted in the 3.75-4.25 percent range in recent weeks despite major outflow of funds on account of repo auctions conducted by the central bank, a dealer said.
Securities prices are likely to see an upward rally by 5-10 basis points for short-dated papers, dealers said.
